data.text: @jcdhtweets Which means absolutely nothing since vaccinated people can get and spread the virus anyway, same as unvaxxed.
@jcdhtweets How many of those "cases" were confirmed by doctors? Or are they all just positive "tests"? With a "process" that is incapable of diagnosing illness?
Outside of identified cases in high-risk settings, people diagnosed with COVID-19 should quickly notify their own close contacts.

Thus, ADPH and JCDH are now prioritizing COVID-19 case investigations for high-risk congregate settings, unusual clusters of cases, and novel or emerging variants of concern.  Not all case investigations warrant notification of close contacts.
⚠️The CDC has updated guidance to end the recommendation for universal case investigation and contact tracing and encourages health departments to focus these activities on high-risk settings...
⚠️Currently 52% of Jefferson County residents are fully vaccinated with 64% receiving at least one dose.

⚠️There has been a 46% decrease in the number cases over the past week.  The age groups with the highest proportion of new cases are those that are age 70 to 79 followed by those 50 to 59 and then those 30 to 39.
